Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Question: Will the Komodo DEX add value to the KMD token? Will the KMD token be used for the transaction fees?

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: Tx fess will be paid in the native coin traded. Making people use komodo to use the dex isnt how it works. That model is reatrictive and only exists to enrich the host token holders. People will find an alternative. Komodo vision is not to be restrictive but enable all to use the tech without needing komodo. Komodo usage on the dex could take preference due to its security and fast tx times.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I claim that the bigger the komodo ecosystem, the better for KMD. Not 1:1, but even 1% to 10% spillover and it will be quite significant. Think about thousands of blockchain projects and the size of the ecosystem, with 1% to 10% spilling over into KMD. Especially as it will be the path of least resistance (most liquidity) for many projects. Also if mm2 does as well as some people say, the KMD buying pressure will be quite big. $1 mil of revshares means 1 million KMD needs to be purchased, that is starting to get into "moving the market" territory

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont underestimate the value of goodwill. this is a concept from the real world where even though it doesnt appear in any direct transaction, it still has a lot of value.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: If you are looking at the short or medium term, maybe these effects are not relevant. I look at the very long term and have tried to optimize the results over that timeframe. There are things in the code dealing with things 10 and 20 years from now

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you want to convert WIF from one coin to another? @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
```
#!/usr/bin/env python3
import hashlib
import base58
import binascii

private_key_WIF = input('key:')

first_encode = base58.b58decode(private_key_WIF)

private_key_full = binascii.hexlify(first_encode)
#print(private_key_full)
private_key = private_key_full[2:-8]

private_key_static = private_key.decode("utf-8")
print('static',private_key_static)
extended_key = "bc"+private_key_static
print('extended_key', extended_key)
first_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(extended_key)).hexdigest()
print('first', first_sha256)
second_sha256 = hashlib.sha256(binascii.unhexlify(first_sha256)).hexdigest()
print('second', second_sha256)

# add checksum to end of extended key
final_key = extended_key+second_sha256[:8]

# Wallet Import Format = base 58 encoded final_key
WIF = base58.b58encode(binascii.unhexlify(final_key))

print (WIF.decode("utf-8"))
```

Author: Alright#0419
Content: change `extended_key = "bc"+private_key_static` to byte found in chainparams.ccp

Content: bc is the correct byte for R addresses
